imp.core.graphics

Class Camera

  • java.lang.Object
    • imp.core.graphics.Camera
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    MockCamera

    public class Camera
extends java.lang.Object
    Defines the view of the user as a camera that the user sees through
    Author:
    kusewskij, kreierj

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static java.lang.String CAMERA_SHADER_NAME
      This is the name of the camera shader program
      static int MAX_NUMBER_OF_LIGHTS
      This is the maximum number of lights supported when drawing a scene.

    • Method Detail

      • rotateAboutArbitraryAxis

        public void rotateAboutArbitraryAxis(Vec3 axis,
                            float degrees)
        The method will rotate the camera about an arbitrary axis passed to it.
        Parameters:
        axis - the axis relative to rotate the camera about.
        degrees - the degrees to rotate by.

      • orbit

        public void orbit(Vec3 point,
         float radians,
         Vec3 axis)
        Orbits the camera about a point in space
        Parameters:
        point - The point to orbit around
        radians - The radians to orbit
        axis - The axis to orbit about

      • moveBackwards

        public void moveBackwards(float speed)
        Moves the camera backwards with the specified speed relative to the opposite direction it is facing.
        Parameters:
        speed - The speed of the camera.

      • stopBackwards

        public void stopBackwards()
        Stop the camera from moving backwards by setting its backwards velocity to a vector with magnitude 0. If the camera was not moving backwards then this method has no effect.

      • moveForward

        public void moveForward(float speed)
        Moves the camera forwards with the specified speed relative to the direction its facing.
        Parameters:
        speed - The speed of the camera.

      • stopForward

        public void stopForward()
        Stop the camera from moving forwards by setting its forwards velocity to a vector with magnitude 0. If the camera was not moving forwards then this method has no effect.

      • moveDown

        public void moveDown(float speed)
        Moves the camera down with the specified speed relative to its down direction.
        Parameters:
        speed - The speed of the camera.

      • stopDown

        public void stopDown()
        Stop the camera from moving down by setting its down velocity to a vector with magnitude 0. If the camera was not moving down then this method has no effect.

      • moveUp

        Moves the camera up with the specified speed relative to its up direction.
        Parameters:

        public void stopUp()
        Stop the camera from moving up by setting its up velocity to a vector with magnitude 0. If the camera was not moving up then this method has no effect.

      • enableCameraShader

        public void enableCameraShader(boolean enable,
                      javax.media.opengl.GL3 g)
        Calling this method will cause the Cameras shader to be used, or cause the shader to not be used if in use.
        Parameters:
        enable - True if the cameras shader should be used, false otherwise.
        g -

      • setOrientationMatrix

        public static void setOrientationMatrix(Mat4 matrix)
        Calling this method will push a 4x4 orientation matrix to the shader to apply to the verticies being drawn so that their local coordinate system is aligned with the orientation matrix. To enable/disable using this matrix a call to useOrientationMatrix() should be made.
        Parameters:
        matrix - The 4x4 orientation matrix.

      • useOrientationMatrix

        public static void useOrientationMatrix(boolean use)
        Calling this method will enable using the 4x4 orientation matrix when drawing one of the imported models. Once the call to draw the model is made you should make a call to this method and pass in false otherwise the orientation matrix will be applied to any vertices passed in after it too.
        Parameters:
        use - true to enable the orientation matrix, false to disable it.

      • draw3D

        public static void draw3D(boolean use)
        Calling this method will enable using the 4x4 orientation matrix when drawing one of the imported models. Once the call to draw the model is made you should make a call to this method and pass in false otherwise the orientation matrix will be applied to any vertices passed in after it too.
        Parameters:
        use - true to enable the orientation matrix, false to disable it.

      • drawTextured

        public static void drawTextured(boolean textured)
        Calling this will enable texturing for the current model being drawn. After the model has been drawn with the texture, the texture should be disabled.
        Parameters:
        textured - true to enable texturing, false to disable it.

      • lookAt

        public void lookAt(javax.media.opengl.GL3 g)
        Recalculates modelToWorld, worldToCamera, and cameraToClip, and sends those values to the shader
        Parameters:
        g -

        Parameters:
